intro: Thryptomene parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered thryptomene, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often have a slight aromatic scent. Thryptomene parviflora is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
